did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Eugene Sonnenberg Boerner was a rose hybridist, horticulturist, and director of research for the Jackson & Perkins Company, Newark, New York.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Personal and family papers include legal documents; diaries; letters from friends and relatives; memorabilia and papers relating to his student days at the University of Wisconsin and the University of Illinois; financial and other records concerning his model farm "Gene's Landing," on Seneca Lake in New York. Professional papers include foreign and domestic correspondence on rose growing and judging; flower photographs; notes and patent books that describe and picture numerous rose varieties and perennials he developed; domestic and foreign parentage seedling books and hybridizing records; and many lectures, articles, photographs, and notes concerning floriculture and his work for Jackson & Perkins Company.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Eugene Sonnenberg Boerner papers, #2639. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.physdesc: News articles, school papers, school memorabilia
